result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

VOLUNTARY APPEARANCE

Canceled warrant with Dispatch  10/14/2022 @ 11:53 AM   Deputy Villiard

11:22 AM Defendant Dillon J. Hall in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Dillon J. Hall.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the court record.  Attny Chapman makes statement as to DEF missed appearance.  DEF makes statement to court as to missed appearance.   State indicates officers were present for a motion hearing in Case 22CF49.  Court reviews Justice Point violation.  Justice Point Representative K. Dussl, makes statement to court as to filed reports.  Attny Chapman makes statement as to violation report.  DEF makes statement as to missed Justice Point appointment.   Court has discussion with DEF.    State makes bond recommendation.  11:35 AM  OFF THE RECORD:   In Chambers Meeting with Attorneys.   11:39 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:  Court makes statement as to discussion of meeting.     State makes bond statement.   Attny Chapman makes bond argument.  Court makes statement regarding bond.    Court reinstates bond SIBS $2500.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and updates address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.  State makes bond recommendation.   Attny Chapman no objection.   Court sets bond.  SIBS $2500  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.
